intro: Artocarpus integrifolius var. heterophyllus, commonly known as the breadfruit tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, lobed leaves and produces a fruit that is widely used for food. The plant is a member of the Moraceae family and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in warm climates. Its fruit, which can be either starchy or sweet depending on the variety, is an important food source in many regions. The tree also has cultural and economic significance in various parts of the world.
